idea-plugin.name: HTTP Client Plus
idea-plugin.description:
Postman‑like UI for composing HTTP requests that saves to IntelliJ's native .http files.

Key features
  • Method selector and URL field with an inline Send button.
  • Mandatory Name field; used as the .http filename and to track/update existing files.
  • Params tab with a key–value table; automatically appends to the URL.
  • Headers tab with a key–value table.
  • Body tab with a Content-Type selector and a compact overflow menu (Beautify JSON).
  • Multipart form-data builder: boundary input and parts table (text or file parts) with Content-Type per part.
  • For POST, adds Content-Type: application/json if missing.
  • Every Send saves/updates the .http file; first Send opens it, later Sends refresh if already open.
  • No separate Save/Retry buttons; Send handles persistence only (execution is manual).
Usage
  • Open via Tools → Open HTTP Client Plus.
  • Fill Name, URL, Params/Headers/Body as needed, then click Send to save.
  • Run the request manually from the editor with Ctrl+Enter.
  • Files are stored under http-client-plus/requests in your project.
